dialogues.text: (punching him playfully) Ah, Adam, you don't know anything about little girls.  She's just... missed out on some love, that's all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (huffy) Let's see if she can get my model back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can build another one... with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam isn't convinced.  Barbara motions him to sit next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come here, I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delia carefully brings out a big plastic bag.  Lays something out on the dining room table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm deeply sentimental about... weddings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia stands to see:  Delia carefully lays out Barbara's white wedding dress.  Then next to it, Adam's wedding tux. Lydia looks at it.  A chill runs through her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed realization) Their wedding clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dramatically) Their wedding clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otho then holds up the handbook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "words".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otho nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia is nervous now.  Otho lights a candle and Delia turns out the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands vermillion / start of five bright cotillion / raven's dive nightshades promise / spirit's strive, to the living / let now the dead... come alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens.  Lydia nervously turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Doo wah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a SIZZLE, a TINY CRACKLE, along one side of the square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara with her arm on his shoulder, talks to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been given a gift here, honey.  A real live little girl. She likes us a lot.  She needs us.  Maybe that's why we died so young, to keep us from getting so... attached to things.  The house, antiques, your model.  Look at us.  We didn't have room for anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long thought) What makes you think she likes me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara slowly smiles.  He does too. He turns to Barbara.  CAMERA HINGES WITH him to see --

dialogues.speaker: ON BARBARA
dialogues.text: Her face is frightened.  She cannot speak.  She reaches out to him -- but is disappearing.  He reaches for her but she is suddenly -- GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Varicolored lightning bolts shoot from every corner of the square.  A gasp from everyone but Lydia. ON LYDIA -- she is looking away.  She turns to see:

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DRESS
dialogues.text: Barbara's wedding dress floats over the table and fills slowly, painfully, with the arms, legs and finally the frightened face of Barbara.  A lightning bolt flares. Lydia rises slowly to her feet, unable to resist. More lightning bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As sudden thunder / Pierces the night; As magic wonder / Mad affright Rives asunder / Man's delight: Our ghost, our corpse and we Rise to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia walks slowly toward Barbara.

dialogues.speaker: ON BARBARA
dialogues.text: She is in pain, she is very slowly aging.  She speaks, but no words can be heard.  Not even by Lydia.  But we can see she is calling for... Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia screams for Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam.  Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) As flies the lizard / Serpent fell; As goblin vizard, / At the spell Of pale wizard, / Sinks to hell; The buried, dead, and slain... Rise again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a lightning flare we see: Adam searching for Barbara.  He rushes out into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara!  Barbara?  Ba...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His last plaintive call becomes mute as he too begins slowly to disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On each of the watchers one by one, scared but delighted too.  No one is watching Lydia. ON LYDIA -- tears well up in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ON BARBARA
dialogues.text: She is slowly aging.  Now a bewildered Adam appears, floating in his wedding suit.  Seeing his Barbara, now older than he is, Adam reaches for her hand... ON HANDS -- as he grasps her hand, it seems to be made of white crepe; it wrinkles and nearly collapses. Adam... puzzled, calls her name silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they suffering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) They're dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're already dead.  They can't feel a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously not true. ON BARBARA -- she looks down slowly at Lydia and with effort makes a loving smile.  She reaches out toward Lydia. Completely helpless now, Lydia weeps openly and then something comes over her.  She rushes across the room. Stares down at the model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?  Help us!  Please. Betelgeuse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone, or something, like the figure of death in the Goya drawing, is perched atop the gravestone of Barbara and Adam Maitland.  The graves beneath him are open. The figure turns... it is Betelgeuse.  He is filing his talons casually. He speaks with a ghastly rasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... You're ready for me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to help them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened) ... I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll help them.  For a price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W... What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his words echo horribly Be... my... queen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repulsed) Your qu...?  But you're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling devilishly) I'm beeyoo-teeful.

dialogues.speaker: ON LYDIA
dialogues.text: She is chilled.  Steps back. She turns back to the Maitlands who are continuing to age.  Looks back to the model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... All right... Betelgeuse...

dialogues.speaker: ON BETELGEUSE
dialogues.text: He doubles in size.  The tombstone crumbles beneath him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) Betelgeuse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doubles in size again.

dialogues.speaker: ON LYDIA
dialogues.text: She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: ON BETELGEUSE
dialogues.text: He looks up at her confidently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betelgeuse!

dialogues.speaker: DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Barbara and Adam's corpses are nearly at the end of their ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, that's enough.  Can you stop this now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otho doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Otho?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late, Charles.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia peers at the model.  Betelgeuse is transforming. There's a LOW RUMBLE.  The model town starts to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia backs away.  Betelgeuse's head, now human-size, rises from the center of the model town.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON HIS FACE
dialogues.text: His grin is malevolent and malicious.  It's showtime, folks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention, K-Mart shoppers!

dialogues.speaker: ON DEETZES
dialogues.text: -- who have been focused on the Maitlands now turning around to the model.

dialogues.speaker: ON MODEL
dialogues.text: Betelgeuse begins a bright but sinister Carnival Barker's pitch.  His shoulders now are clearing the model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Winter River!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah rushes over to the model, thinking this is more of the show.  Maxie follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hel LO Piggies!  Welcome to Winter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: River!  See the Museum of Natural Greed.  The Monument to Bored Businessmen!  Come closer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Betelgeuse's arms elongate, swell and CRACKLE.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAXIE AND SARAH
dialogues.text: Their eyes grow wide.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON BETELGEUSE'S HANDS
dialogues.text: They split, unfurl, and transmutate into two, shiny, huge sledgehammers.

dialogues.speaker: ON BETELGEUSE
dialogues.text: He grins, his eyes sparkle in anticipation.  CARNEY MUSIC UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (roughly to the tune of "Santa Claus is Coming to Town") You better not sell, you better not buy...

dialogues.speaker: ON MAXIE AND SARAH
dialogues.text: Behind each of them, a graduated CARNIVAL BELL RINGING GAME STANDARD erects itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still singing) Or old Uncle Beetle Claus will be makin'... you... fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betelgeuse swings his hammer/hands and sends Max and Sarah zooming through the roof.  GONG.  GONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in style of game show host) Yowser, yowser.  Well, who do we have here tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at the suspended Maitlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a hand for the Maitlands, Barbara and Adam.  They deserve a rest.

dialogues.speaker: ON MAITLANDS
dialogues.text: Wispy shadows by now, but still alive/dead.  They fall in a heap on the floor.  NOTE:  They immediately start to regenerate themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll get back to them after they recover from their flight.

dialogues.speaker: ON ADAM
dialogues.text: Filling out again, he struggles to stand, but falls. Barbara shakes her head, trying to regain her focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) My God, what ugly wall dressing. Who is responsible for all this ugliness? (spying Otho trying to hide) Otho, it's you!  Watch out for the taste patrol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves and the door opens.  A little Italian gentle- man appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Noooo!  My God.  It's Giorgio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armani!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before youa getta started herea, I joost wanta to saya, Otho, don'ta weara my stuff?  Okay? Youa too fat for human-type clothes.  Ita makes my designs looka like aircraft covering!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otho is horrified.  Suddenly he looks down and sees his clothing has transformed into a polyester nightmare. He runs out the door screaming.  Betelgeuese laughs with delight then focuses on Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's leave this crazy world behind us.  I'll take you out in style!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound of eerie WEDDING MARCH.  The fireplace changes into an expressionist altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His leering horned whores walk like bridesmaids, in step, through the door.  They rush toward Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightened, Lydia is assaulted and pulled forward by these ugly handmaidens; she suddenly looks down and sees she is now clothed in a blood-red wedding dress. Lydia screams!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened, but hurling the incan- tation to make him disappear) No... Betelgeuse.  Bet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betelgeuse waves a hand and Lydia's mouth freezes. Delia and Charles plead with the recovering Maitlands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) Please, can't you do something! Please!

dialogues.speaker: ON BARBARA AND ADAM
dialogues.text: Adam, not fully recovered, heroically tries to speak -- but his jaw falls off.  An exhausted Barbara tries to help him reattach it. Betelgeuse looks at Lydia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know if we're going to get married, we're going to need witnesses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betelgeuse shifts his glare to Charles and Delia. From Behind, Delia's horrid sculptures come to life and attack Charles and Delia.  The sculptures twist around them, forcing them to watch the hideous spectacle. Adam and Barbara are rapidly trying to recover as the ceremony begins.

dialogues.speaker: A DEATH-MASKED OLD PREACHER
dialogues.text: slides down the fireplace, ready to perform the service, speaks with a hissing death rattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you, Betel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mouth drops and is frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-uh!  No one says the B word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you, _____________, take this woman to be your wedded wife?  To honor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You betcha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia screams and struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... you?  Do you, Lydia, take this man?... er, uh... man... to be your lawful wedded husband?... In sickness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia struggles.  Her screams are muffled and distant. Betelgeuse grabs her and shakes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to answer him, snookums.  I'll do it for you. (eerily, speaking in her voice) I'm Lydia Deetz and I'm of sound mind.  The man next to me is the one I want.  You asked me... I'm answering.  Yes.  How I love that man of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, now fully regenerated, moves toward them.  He shouts the incantation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beetle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betelgeuse turns to him and with a sweep of his hand, Adam's teeth (as if they were false), fly out of his mouth and CLATTER to the floor.  Adam, toothless, musters up his ghost powers and -- ON TEETH - TIGHT -- they rare back and continue shouting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beetleju...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayhem breaks out.  A furious Betelgeuse stomps at them with his feet.  The teeth scuttle under the model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily, to old man) Now move it, pops!

dialogues.speaker: ON ADAM
dialogues.text: Speechless, Adam heroically charges toward Betelgeuse, ready to strike him.  Betelgeuse spins on him and waves his hand.  SOUND OF RUSHING WIND.

dialogues.speaker: ON ADAM
dialogues.text: He has been zapped into his model town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara screams and jumps at Betelgeuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beetlegeuse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betelgeuse turns on her, eyes flashing.

dialogues.speaker: ON BARBARA
dialogues.text: A gag comes over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ON MODEL
dialogues.text: Adam is running around the streets trying to get out of the model.  He looks up into the sky, sees a red glow and THUNDERING WEDDING MUSIC.  He doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: ON BARBARA
dialogues.text: She tears away her face (like tissue) and tries to say his name again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betelgeuse...

dialogues.speaker: ON BETELGEUSE
dialogues.text: More angry, he waves his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ON BARBARA
dialogues.text: Her lips are zippered shut.

dialogues.speaker: IN MODEL
dialogues.text: Desperate, Adam gets an idea.  He runs over to the truck Betelgeuse had crashed earlier, jumps in and tries to start it.

dialogues.speaker: ON BARBARA
dialogues.text: She unzips her mouth and tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be

dialogues.speaker: ON BETELGEUSE
dialogues.text: Fire darts from his eyes....

dialogues.speaker: ON BARBARA
dialogues.text: A chromium steel plate is riveted across her mouth. She screams wordlessly behind it.

dialogues.speaker: IN MODEL
dialogues.text: Adam finally gets the truck started.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARA
dialogues.text: Struggling with her mouth, frustrated to the breaking point, she looks all around the room and rushes to the window and CRASHES through into the night.

dialogues.speaker: IN MODEL
dialogues.text: Adam sees Barbara rush out.  He looks back at Betelgeuse, floors the gas pedal and goes for one last shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Now, let's get rolling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, by the authority vested in me by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUMBLE comes from outside.  Everyone notices but the Preacher.  He stutters to finish the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By me!  Get on with it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUDER NOISE from outside.  Now nearly DEAFENING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... by him.  I now pronounce you man and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck is racing up to Betelgeuse's foot.  Adam bails out just in time as the truck hits Betelgeuse's foot and EXPLODES, giving him a distracting hot foot, then --

dialogues.speaker: ON WINDOW
dialogues.text: Through it -- amidst a cloud of yellow dust -- CRASHES the sand worm.  Barbara rides him bareback.  Barbara struggles to control the ROARING worm.  She pulls on his ears and looks around for Beetle Juice.  Seeing him, she spurs the Worm after Beetle Juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beetle Juice struggles, trying to run from the worm. But Barbara and the worm outmaneuver him, corner him, and when the worm reaches him, he opens his hungry mouth and gulps Betelgeuse in one mouthful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrrrat shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara leaps off, as the Sand Worm continues down through the floorboards of the house Betelgeuse is gone.  Adam is back to full size. Charles and Delia are no longer held by the sculptures. Lydia runs back to her family and Adam and Barbara. The dust settles.

dialogues.speaker: ON HOLE
dialogues.text: peers into the room.  She pulls the whores through the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRDS SING.  Ernie polishes the lion.  Old Bill sleeps. People stroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lovely white boarding school with long, green lawn. A BELL RINGS.  Girls come out the front door.  Say goodbyes.  Lydia walks out too, carrying books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bye, Serena.  See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia walks along Main Street of Winter River.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane is getting out of her car -- Little Jane follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellooo!  How's school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not particularly interested) It's okay.  How's the dirt business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm expecting a call from your parents.  I have some news for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane hears PHONE RING from inside, rushes in to answer it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them I'll call them tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie polishes the lion.  Lydia passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget the balls, Ernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane screams into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean no?  After all I've done for you.  I don't do this for my health you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA EXPLORES a row of photographs of houses for sale. ON PHOTOGRAPH -- of the old Maitland house.  It is delapidated and haunted-looking.  A legend reads: Fixer-Upper's Special." BACK TO JANE -- she is frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have here a bona fide offer of $250,000.00 for that dump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Jane is now at the Xerox machine.  The NOISE irritates Big Jane and she throws a wad of paper at Little Jane.  Little Jane gets mad and throws her papers into the air and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recognize the furniture.  It's the Deetzes'.  Delia is on the phone to Jane.  Charles comes in with the Wall Street Journal.  He fidgets, taps his fingers, as he reads and pours coffee -- all at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper to Charles) It's Mrs. Butterworth again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles picks up the extension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Jane.  We don't want anyone looking at the house.  We don't want it painted, the yard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: mowed, the trees trimmed, nor do we want it termite inspected. It's not for sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane listens.  Silent.  Thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.  Okay for now.  When will you sell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Never, honey.  Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.  Looks at Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Some people never know when to leave things the way they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND OF SWEEPING -- CAMERA eases up -- Barbara is sweeping.  Adam working on his model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3:30 I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give or take a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara smiles. The KITCHEN DOOR SLAMS.  Barbara looks up at Adam. They smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get the paint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.  And I took pictures of the new church for you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do on the science test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hangs her head) It was gross.  They wanted me to dissect a frog.  I told them no way.  I said it was against my religion.  I got a C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam frowns a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you do on the math test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia looks down coyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We studied all day yesterday. Don't tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an A!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They grin with pride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So can I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Uh-uh.  Only if you got above a C on science.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, go on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Adam, don't tease her.  You never got an A in science in your life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON LYDIA -- she puts down her books.  Loosens her collar, ruffles her hair and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia looks down.  Lydia begins to levitate. She lifts her head and leaves the white bread world behind!  In a voice as deep and soulful as Percy Sledge:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "When a man loves a woman. He can't keep his mind on nothin' else."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her ghostly images of the football players appear as back-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooooo.  Hummm oooooo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd change the world for the good thing he's found.  When a main needs a woman, He cain't keep his mind on nothin' else.  If she's bad, he won't see it, she can do no wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great pile of sand with the whorehouse in the middle.  An irritated Betelgeuse crawls out on the roof.  Hating the singing he shakes his fist at the sky -- loses his footing and tumbles into the sand. Terrified, he scrambles to get out.

dialogues.speaker: ON PILE
dialogues.text: A moving coil under the sand sends him scurrying inside again.  The Sandworm SNAPPING right behind him as he runs back out on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TILTS UP to see house.  It is the perfect, New England house.  CAMERA PULLS BACK from the model -- out the window of the real house. Outside the real house -- we see it is dilapidated, and undeniably, the perfect haunted house.
